content.question: ​The polynomial function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals a x to the power of 4 plus b x cubed plus c x squared plus d x plus k"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>4</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>k</mi></math>, where <math alttext="a not equal to 0"><mi>a</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="b"><mi>b</mi></math>, <math alttext="c"><mi>c</mi></math>, <math alttext="d"><mi>d</mi></math>, and <math alttext="k"><mi>k</mi></math> are constants. Which of the following statements about <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is true?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> has both a global maximum and a global minimum.
​<math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> has either a global maximum or a global minimum, but not both.
​<math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> has neither a global maximum nor a global minimum.

​The nature of a global maximum or a global minimum for <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> cannot be determined without more information about <math alttext="b"><mi>b</mi></math>, <math alttext="c"><mi>c</mi></math>, <math alttext="d"><mi>d</mi></math>, and <math alttext="k"><mi>k</mi></math>.

content.answer: ​<math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> has either a global maximum or a global minimum, but not both.
